definition: Chen Duxiu (1879-1942), co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1921
surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale
alone/independent/single/sole/only
handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears

sentences.english: Chen Duxiu was still for moderation and concessions to the Wuhan Kuomintang.
sentences.chinese: 陈独秀却依然主张对武汉国民党的妥协退让。

sentences.english: The first proposing Chen Duxiu goes to Moscow was Far East Bureau.
sentences.chinese: 共产国际代表主张陈独秀赴莫斯科目的是惩罚他。

sentences.english: This article tries to give a brief discussion on Chen's achievements and mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 本文试对陈独秀的功过是非略陈管见。

sentences.english: Chen Duxiu Corrected the left-wing three times during the period of the Great revolution which is reasonable.
sentences.chinese: 大革命时期陈独秀的三次纠“左”皆是无可厚非的。

sentences.english: The first part is about the formation of the background and conditions of Chen Duxiu's idea of newspaper and periodicals.
sentences.chinese: 五四前后陈独秀报刊编辑思想形成的背景和条件。

sentences.english: The first part is about the formation of Chen Duxiu's democratic thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 本文第一章是陈独秀的资产阶级民主思想。

sentences.english: Chen Duxiu was a pioneer in moral revolution in modern Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 陈独秀是近代革命的先驱。

sentences.english: A period of time before the Revolution of 1911 witnessed the participation of Chen Duxiu in the rebellious parties.
sentences.chinese: 陈独秀在辛亥革命前曾有过一段投身“乱党”的日子。

sentences.english: Chen Du - xiu had been pursuing socialism before he degraded himself into a Trotskyite .
sentences.chinese: 社会主义是陈独秀蜕变为托派以前矢志不渝的追求。

sentences.english: In his life, anti_coufucianist thought is one of Cheng Du_xiu's thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 反孔教是陈独秀一生中始终坚持的思想之一。

sentences.english: In brief, the Chen Duxiu thought is the democracy and the science.
sentences.chinese: 简言之，陈独秀思想即民主和科学。

definition: Li Dazhao (1889-1927), early Chinese Marxist and founding member of the communist party

Qu Qiubai (1899-1935), politician, Soviet expert of the Chinese communists at time of Soviet influence, publisher and Russian translator, captured and executed by Guomindang at the time of the Long March
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Zhang Taiyan (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution
Wu Yuzhang (1878-1966), writer, educator and communist politician
Song Jiaoren (1882-1913), politician of the revolutionary party involved in the 1911 Xinhai revolution, murdered in Shanghai in 1913
Zhang Wentian (1900-1976), CCP party leader and theorist
Liu Shipei (1884-1919), Chinese anarchist and revolutionary activist
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Zhang Taiyan 章太炎 (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution
Dong Biwu (1886-1975), one of the founders of the Chinese communist party
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader

Zhou Zuoren (1885-1967), brother of Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅, academic in Japanese and Greek studies, briefly imprisoned after the war as Japanese collaborator, persecuted and died of unknown causes during the Cultural Revolution
